General transportation sector,General water, sanitation and flood

trustfund: TF028639-GET-PPA ECUADOR BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION,TF028700-GET-BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Biodiversity Protection Project did
            not restructure and strengthen institutional capacity to
            manage the National System of Protected Areas (NSPA).
            Nonetheless, it may be considered to have been satisfactory
            from the perspective of having contributed experience in
            defining an institutional and financial framework for
            biodiversity protection and a research base from which to
            develop a follow-on program. The lessons drawn from this
            project include: 1) The project was designed to improve an
            organization that had been given a role and a legal
            structure without having had experience on the ground. A
            project coordination unit was mandated to perform this task
            form within Ecuadorean Institute of Agrarian Reform
            Institute, of Forestry, Natural Areas and Wildlife (INEFAN).
            This was the root of poor ownership of the project by
            INEFAN. 2) The involvement of communities in the planning
            and implementation of sustainable resource management and
            biodiversity protection was shown to be important. 3) The
            collaboration between public authorities and the NGOs and
            bilateral communities is important. However, the project
            failed to bring these interests together at the central
            level. An explicit process should be included in the
            project's basic design, with resources identified as
            needed to make this effective at all levels. 4) The
            monitoring and evaluation system should have been functioned
            before the project began.
